page.title: 10WEST CLIFFE HAMLET
page.content: West Cliffe is a fine example of a settlement little changed by time. Originally an 8th century name,the hamlet appears in the 1086 Survey as Westclive. At this time the land was worked by "17 villeins" and oddly there are exactly that number of people living there today. There is a small church (St.Peters)which holds 2 services a month. 2 centuries ago the services were only held monthly. As regards other buildings there is still 1 farm. A second,Walletts Court,closed 10 years ago and recently reopened as a smart family guest house and restaurant with 7 bedrooms. There are 3 other houses,8 barns,6 sheds and 1 garage. On the Survey day there were 7 cars in the village. These enable the villagers to get to Dover to shop. Few villagers ever use buses. The quiet is valued by the residents.
